name: Integrity Check
description: Linux application written in Vala and GTK, designed to get the verification sum of a file (MD5, SHA1, SHA256) and compare to the sum of verification provided by the file creator.

name: Akira
description: Native Linux App for UI and UX Design built in Vala and GTK.

name: Birdfont
description: A font editor for creating fonts in TTF, EOT, SVG and BIRDFONT format.

name: GitG
description: A graphical user interface for git.

name: VAMM (Vinari OS Apache & MariaDB Manager)
description: Manages LAMP services using a GTK 3 GUI.

name: High Score (GNOME Games)
description: Retro gaming application for the GNOME desktop.

name: Sage
description: A code breaking game made for elementary OS.

name: Warble
description: Native Linux word-guessing game built in Vala and Gtk for elementary OS.

name: Starfish
description: A Gemini browser for elementary OS.

name: g4music
description: A beautiful, fast, fluent, light weight music player written in GTK4.

name: Korembi
description: A beautiful and customizable wallpapers manager for Linux.

name: Badger
description: Remind yourself to not sit and stare at the screen for too long.

name: Blackbox
description: A beautiful GTK 4 terminal.

name: Flowtime
description: GTK4 Libadwaita Pomodoro Timer.

name: geary
description: Geary is an email application built around conversations, for the GNOME 3 desktop.

name: GNOME Calculator
description: The calculator app for the GNOME desktop.

name: graphui
description: Graph Visualization based on graphviz.

name: Ideogram
description: Emoji Picker app.

name: Notejot
description: Stupidly-simple notes app.

name: Notes-up
description: Markdown notes editor & manager.

name: Paper
description: Take notes in Markdown.

name: pdfpc
description: A GTK presenter application with multi-monitor support for PDF files.

name: Planner
description: Task manager with Todoist support designed for GNU/Linux.

name: Spice-up
description: Presentations App for the modern Linux Desktop.

name: Connections
description: A remote desktop client for the GNOME desktop environment.

name: elementary OS App Center
description: Pay-what-you-can app store for elementary OS.

name: Man Helper
description: A lightweight GTK front-end for man pages.

name: Monitor
description: Manage processes and monitor system resources.

name: Peek
description: Simple animated GIF screen recorder with an easy to use interface.

name: SwayNotifiationCenter
description: A simple GTK based notification daemon for SwayWM.

name: GNOME Boxes
description: A simple GNOME 3 application to access virtual machines.

name: Meteo
description: GTK Weather app using the OpenWeatherMap API.

name: EasyDocs
description: Quickly read developer documentation.

name: Spider
description: Quickly generate a HTML5 site structure.

name: Valdo
description: Create new Vala projects from templates.

name: Vala VSCode
description: A plugin for Visual Studio Code that enables basic autocompletion and syntax highlighting for Vala.

name: Vala-TMBundle
description: A TextMate bundle that provides Vala syntax highlighting, code completion, etc. Sublime Text 3 can also use this plugin.

name: language-vala-modern
description: Provides Vala language support in Atom. It's a fork of the unmaintained "language-vala package".

name: Vala Syntax 4 Sublime Text
description: A basic plugin for Sublime Text 3 that provides syntax highlighting.

name: vala-language-server
description: A language server that aims to provide code completion, formatting, syntax highlighting, and everything else according to the Language Server spec.

name: console-command
description: Library to route command-line arguments to a Command pattern object, current implementation covers extension by inheritance or using closures.

name: gpseq
description: A parallelism library for Vala and GObject.

name: GnuTLS
description: A secure communications library implementing the SSL, TLS and DTLS protocols and technologies around them. It provides a simple API to access the secure communications protocols as well as APIs to parse and write X.509, PKCS #12, and other required structures.

name: Graphene
description: A thin layer of types for graphic libraries. It provides common types needed to handle 3D transformations: points, triangles, rectangles, quads, quaternions, vectors, matrices, spheres, etc.

name: Libgee
description: A utility library providing GObject-based interfaces and classes for commonly used data structures (lists, maps, queues, trees, etc.).

name: Numeric-GLib
description: A collection of numeric data types for GLib (and Vala) via GCC extensions. It includes 128 bit integers & floats, complex types, vectorized operations, and decimal types.

name: United
description: A library for unit manipulation (like kilograms, meters, etc).

name: vul (Vala Utility Libraries)
description: A set of utility libraries for Vala that add: Text stream handling (input and output), JSON serialization and deserialization, and, Archive compression and extraction.

name: Almanna ORM
description: The Almanna ORM for Vala/GLib.

name: Babl
description: A dynamic, any to any, pixel format translation library.

name: Cairo
description: A 2D graphics library with support for multiple output devices. This is pretty much the default library you get in Vala.

name: GEGL
description: A data flow based image processing framework, providing floating point processing and non-destructive image processing capabilities. Think of it as "Reactive Programming for Images".

name: GRX
description: A graphics library for simple graphics displays (think 1-bit displays or Adafruit's PiTFT displays). It also includes keyboard, mouse, joystick and touchscreen input support.

name: GSVG (GObject SVG Library)
description: GSVG is an effort to provide a GLib GObject implementation of W3C standard API.

name: live-chart
description: A real-time charting library for Vala and GTK3 based on Cairo.

name: SDL2
description: A cross-platform development library designed to provide low level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware via OpenGL, Direct3D, and Vulkan. Bindings are included in Vala and will be available starting with Vala 0.52.

name: GTK
description: The de facto library for GUI development in Vala. Bindings are included with the vala compiler.

name: Vadi
description: An IoC Container developed in order to facilitate the usage of dependency injection for Vala developers.

name: GStreamer
description: A powerful framework for creating multimedia applications.

name: balistica
description: An open source ballistic simulation library. There's a complete calculator here.

name: vast
description: A project for generative modeling in Vala. Think of TensorFlow rewritten in Vala.

name: Compose
description: A functional templating library for Vala.

name: template-glib
description: A library for template expansion which supports calling into GObject Introspection from templates.

name: libcmark-vapi
description: Vala bindings for libcmark, the CommonMark parsing and rendering library in C.

name: Ambition
description: A web framework written in Vala, with the MVC pattern in mind. Kinda unmaintained (someone could refactor it to use Valum under the hood, and maybe move it to Meson 😉).

name: Valum
description: A Web micro-framework entirely written in Vala.

name: GXML
description: A GObject API for manipulating XML and a Serializable framework from GObject to XML.

name: Json-GLib
description: Implements a full JSON parser and generator using GLib and GObject, and integrates JSON with GLib data types.

name: libyaml-glib
description: The GLib binding of libyaml, plus a GObject builder that understands YAML.
